description: The secret headquarters of the Revolutionary Army, led by Monkey D. Dragon. A hidden island location where the Revolutionary Army conducts intelligence operations and plans their activities against the World Government.

keyEvents.title: Baltigo Location Debut
keyEvents.description: Baltigo is revealed for the first time as the secret headquarters of the Revolutionary Army.
keyEvents.significance: First reveal of the Revolutionary Army's base of operations, a critical location in the overall story.

keyEvents.title: Dragon Observes Luffy's Bounty
keyEvents.description: At Baltigo, Dragon and Terry Gilteo review the Straw Hats' bounty posters.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the Revolutionary Army's interest in the Straw Hats' activities.

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' second ship, designed and built by Franky with wood from the legendary Treasure Tree Adam. Features advanced technology including the Coup de Burst emergency acceleration system.

keyEvents.title: Official Naming of the Thousand Sunny
keyEvents.description: The ship receives its official name 'Thousand Sunny' suggested by Iceburg before the crew departs Water 7.
keyEvents.significance: The ship's christening marks a new chapter for the Straw Hat Pirates.

keyEvents.title: First Use of Coup de Burst
keyEvents.description: The Thousand Sunny's emergency acceleration system is used for the first time to escape from Vice Admiral Garp.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the ship's advanced capabilities and saves the crew from a powerful Marine.

statusHistory.reason: Serving as the Straw Hat Pirates' ship

description: A small village in the East Blue where Monkey D. Luffy grew up. The villagers know Luffy well and celebrate his achievements despite his status as a wanted pirate.

keyEvents.title: Foosha Village Celebrates Luffy's Bounty
keyEvents.description: The villagers of Foosha Village celebrate Luffy's increased bounty of 300,000,000 berries with pride, though Mayor Woop Slap disapproves.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the village's continued support for Luffy despite his criminal status.

description: Usopp's hometown, a peaceful village where Kaya lives and where Usopp used to tell tall tales to the villagers.

keyEvents.title: Syrup Village Recognizes Sogeking
keyEvents.description: Kaya and the Usopp Pirates immediately recognize Sogeking as Usopp through his distinctive nose and celebrate his bounty.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates that those who know Usopp can easily see through his disguise.

description: Nami's hometown, a village that was once oppressed by Arlong and his crew. Now free, the villagers cherish Nami and celebrate her achievements.

keyEvents.title: Genzo's Reaction to Nami's Bounty
keyEvents.description: Genzo receives Nami's bounty poster and objects to it being 'too lewd' but displays it anyway. Nojiko notes that Nami looks genuinely happy.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the village's protective care for Nami and recognition of her happiness with the crew.

description: A floating restaurant ship in the East Blue where Sanji worked as a cook before joining the Straw Hat Pirates. Run by chef Zeff.

keyEvents.title: Baratie Displays Sanji's Wanted Poster
keyEvents.description: Zeff and the Baratie crew mock Sanji's poorly drawn wanted poster but proudly display it as the restaurant's centerpiece, using it as a selling point.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the Baratie crew's pride in Sanji despite his wanted status.

description: A winter island in the Grand Line, also known as Sakura Kingdom. Chopper's homeland where Dr. Kureha still resides.

keyEvents.title: Kureha Sees Chopper's Bounty
keyEvents.description: Dr. Kureha and King Dalton receive Chopper's bounty poster of 50 berries. Despite the low amount, Kureha is pleased to see him doing well.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Kureha's maternal affection for Chopper and pride in his adventures.

description: A desert kingdom in the Grand Line ruled by King Nefertari Cobra. Home to Princess Vivi, who traveled with the Straw Hats.

keyEvents.title: Vivi Learns Robin Travels with Straw Hats
keyEvents.description: The Arabasta royal family learns that Nico Robin is with the Straw Hat Pirates. Vivi trusts Luffy's judgment completely.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Vivi's complete faith in Luffy despite Robin's former role as their enemy.
